Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of a female figure facing right (chiton and elaborate over-garment decorated with asterisks; part of something curved with black dots on left) with a slanting spear shaft by her side; on right, a tropaion with a slanting spear pointing downwards.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski gives following comparanda: Style: ARV 551, 17 (s.v. Anymone Painter) = CVA Berlin (3) 7 pl. 101; Subject: Boston 20.187 (ARV2 857,2 = LIMC VI (1992) no. 59 s.v. Nike). The figure should be Athena rather than Nike with the elaborate over-garment and spear, and perhaps a trace of her aegis on the far left. Also published in CVA Bonn (1), p.18 pl.16.7.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.42 no. C 18 pl. 15.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1096)
